All About PHP

May 3, 2021

What is PHP?

  • PHP, or Hypertext Preprocessor, is an open source scripting language that is executed on the server side.
  • It can create, open, read, write, delete, and close files on the server (among many other things!)
  • Essentially, PHP does all the things HTML, CSS, and JS can’t do, like working with data and assembling pages
  • PHP files can contain a combination of HTML and PHP

General Notes About Syntax

  • File extension is .php
  • Each statement ends with a ;
  • Single line comments use //, multiple lines use /* */
  • Variables can operate at a global, local, and static level (all using $)
  • PHP uses types such as string, integer, float, boolean, array, object, NULL, and resource (but you don’t need to declare them!)

Basic Syntax

  • A PHP script begins with <?php and ends with ?>
  • include: imports files for dynamic pages
  • echo: outputs the results of the code
  • print: same as echo, but has a return value of 1
  • array("A","B","C") or array("Taylor"=>"20", "Johnny"=>"22"): can be equated to a variable, can also make an array in an array (aka multidimensional). indexed at 0
  • var_dump($x): returns the data type and value of the variable
  • null: a variable that has no value assigned to it (can also be used to empty a variable)
  • constants: a global identifier for a simple value (cannot be changed during the script)

Strings

  • strlen(“Hello World!”): returns the length of a string
  • str_word_count(“Hello World!”): counts the number of words in a string
  • strrev(“Hello World!”): reverses a string
  • strpos(“Hello World!”, “World”): searches for specific text within a string. If found, returns number of beginning character position
  • str_replace(“world, “dolly”, “Hello world!”): replaces the world with dolly in the existing string

Numbers

integers: a number with no decimal point (can be positive or negative)

  • is_int($x): checks if the variable type is an integer floats: a number with a decimal or exponential form
  • is_float($x): checks if the variable type is a float other kinds of numeric operators:
  • is_finite($x)
  • is_infinite($x)
  • is_numeric($x)
  • $int_cast: casts float to int, or vice versa

PHP Operators

  • $x ** $y: raise $x to the $y th power
  • $x % $y: remainder of $x divided by $y

PHP Comparison Operators

  • ==: equal
  • ===: identical
  • !=: not equal (also <>)
  • !==: not identical
  • <=>: spaceship (returns an integer less than, equal to, or greater than zero depending if $x is less than, equal to, or greater than $y)

switch statements: selects one of many blocks of code to be executed


$favcolor  
switch($favcolor){
case “red”:
echo “ur fav color red!”;
break;
case “blue”;
echo “ur fav color blue!”;
break;
default:
echo “none of these r ur fav”;
}
